intro: Tetranthera semecarpifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces woody, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, with a dense canopy and glossy foliage. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is considered a problematic species in certain ecosystems.
